Basic details: Margaret Lee, a 63-year-old woman, comes to the clinic for a follow-up of her diabetes management.
Vitals:
BP: 140/90 mm Hg
Temp: 97.8°F (36.6°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 78/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sit comfortably in the chair, appearing slightly fatigued.
Mention feeling more tired than usual over the past few weeks.
If asked about blood sugar levels, say, "I try to check them regularly, but sometimes I forget."
Challenging question: "Why do I feel so tired all the time? Is my diabetes getting worse?"
